item.title: English are walking record distances but car is still most popular form of transport
item.description:
Department for Transport’s travel survey also found the Covid-era shift to cycling continued to fizzle away

The English are walking record distances, official figures show – but charities have warned that more needs to be done to get people on their feet.

According to government data, the average walking journey increased in length last year, even as most other forms of day-to-day travel continued to lag behind pre-pandemic levels.

Continue reading...
